message.raw:
Fixed a massive issue -- the pineblaster has always been prodicing incorrect
output. The digital low in between instructions had the wrong length due to
incorrect timing of switching periods on the output compare module. By adding
a little bit of code at the start of a run that sets a small period and waits
until the digital high is reached before loading in the first instruction period,
the timing is then correct for the rest of the run.

This also means that the minimum wait is on the order of microseconds rather than
milliseconds. The period of the instruction after the wait was contributing to
the wait time!
